transcripts.text: So now, Hosea says to Am Yisrael, return to God.  Return to God because your sins are not working out.  How do we know your life is terrible?  You don't have Hashem in your life.  If you do not have Hashem in your life, it is impossible to be happy, successful, or anything of any value.

You have no connection to the purpose of creation.  So Hosea says to us, Says Ta'am Yisrael, return.  Return unto Hashem.  Shuvah Yisrael Ad Hashem.  So the sages explained, if you really want to do Shuvah, it must be every day.  It must be every day.  You have to work on yourself to perfect your character, to perfect all of the flaws, every single day.  Until you get all the way to Hashem.  Ad Hashem.  Moshe Rabbeinu says, in Sefer Devarim, It's in your mouth, it's in your heart to do it.  Meaning, you were created to learn and fulfill the Torah.  That's it.  That's what you were created for.

The light of you, Hashem, people walk through.  Your light guide them.  Everyone is rejoicing in your name.  And with your righteousness, they are lifting themselves spiritually.  You are the glory of their strength.  And when you want... Our level rise sharply just when you want.  All we have to do is to get you to want.  Once you want, nobody can stand next to us.  Because our Lord is our saviour and the holy of the nation of Israel.  He is our king.  Then you spoke of the prophecy of the prophet Samuel.  You told him, I gave strength to the hero.  I lifted the chosen one from the nation.  Who is he talking about?  King David.  Samuel was the prophet in the time of David the king.  Samuel the prophet.  The one on top of all the kings of the world.  I found, I picked David from millions, and I put my holy oil, Shemen HaMishchah, from the horn that Shmuel the prophet put on his head, eventually become the king, but not just the king in this world.  The king of Mashiach.  The kingdom, the final kingdom will come also from him.  With my holy oil, I poured on his head.  My hand is supporting him.  My arm strengthens him.  No enemies can deceive him.  And a despicable human being cannot torture him.  I am going to break all his enemies in front of him.  And I will defeat his enemies.  My strength, my faith, my support is always with him.  The Zohar in Parashat Shemot 7.  This is what the Zohar say.  It will be darkness in all the land of Egypt.  To the future to come.  This was written 2000 years ago.  There will be The wicked Jews.  When Mashiach would come, the Messiah will arrive.  There will be Jews.  The liberals.  The anti-religion.  That will join the nations to help them to fight against Mashiach.  In a final revenge against all the anti-Semites.  Don't be so surprised.  And the Zohar in Parashat Pinchas, Resh Mem Tet, this is what it says.  In those 15 days of darkness, there will be a disaster for all the leaders of the Erev Rav.  Now you understand why you have in Israel half of the government who constantly make fun at the Torah and at the rabbis and at Hashem.  If you worship Hashem and also worship society, you would be left with nothing.  You have to make a decision.  You are with me or you are against me.  Many, many Jews lost their olam haba.  From our nation.  Why are they going to keep mitzvot?  I don't know.  What is the word for them?  They don't have a share to the world to come already.  Because the damage that they made, irreversible.  There's no way to fix it.

The one who lacks emunah does not attract disciples, nor teach anyone about trusting in Hashem.  But the one that has fake emunah, he teaches others to be false just like him.  When that's revealed, his despicable action against his fellow man will become known, and then people will say of him, look at that man who studied Musar, but look how shameful his actions are.  He says the person that's a faker, All of these fake speakers, whatever they are, these self-help people, some Jewish, some not.  He says those people are much worse than anybody else.  Why?  Because they have disciples.  They teach people they're fake.  They teach people they're false.

How are you going to fix it?  Now you put Phil in, and the minute you put Phil in, someone is being murdered because of you.  And tomorrow another one, and another one tomorrow.  And every new person who sees it, it's affecting him, he believes the lies over there, and he reacts based on that.  You cannot do tshuva for them.  You have to pay for the damage you cause the religion.  You have to pay for the anger you cause God.  You have to pay for all the children and people that are dying in our nation because of this horrible crime.  And in those 15 days all the Erev Rav leaders that control Israel, they will all be clean from the face of the earth.

idol after idol.  But the moment he heard the truth and he realized this is it, he heard it, he fulfilled it.  That's what Shuvah is.  You heard it, do it.  Do it right away.  Do it as soon as possible.  Don't let anybody else tell you, no, no, you're being fanat, you're being nothing.  You know it's right, you do it.  Forget about your upbringing, your down-bringing, your is-bringing, all that stuff is excuses, it's not going to work.  No one is going to fight for you in the bed-deen of Shamayim, no one.  Only your own actions are going to fight for you.  A person realizes that, he starts fixing his actions, she starts fixing her actions.  B'ezrat Hashem, we all start fixing our actions, but the reality is, Rabotai, I think it's more than enough for each one of us to take something out of what we've learned today, and B'ezrat Hashem, at least begin our tshuvah.
